oai_dc:dc.dc:title: BVD: Getting a Positive Diagnosis
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Vickers, Mary Lynne
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Bovine viral diarrhea virus
clinical signs
diagnosis
control measures
BVDV
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bovine viral diarrhea virus (BVDV) is a ubiquitous virus that is the most frequently isolated viral pathogen of cattle in some areas. BVDV virus infection is often suspected because of the wide range of disease problems it causes. This variety of clinical signs has complicated the diagnosis of this viral infection because there are no simple answers. It is, however, essential that a definitive diagnosis be made before costly control measures are implemented.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1992: Volume 2; 158-161
